definition: a formal written warrant granting the power to perform various acts or duties
a certificate conferring military rank and authority, the rank and authority so conferred
examples: received a lieutenant's commission in the army

definition: an authorization or command to act in a prescribed manner or to perform prescribed acts : charge
examples: a commission to serve as notary public

definition: a formal request to produce something (especially an artistic work) in exchange for payment, a work produced by commission
examples: … he found his footing as a Western artist when he received a commission in 1958 to create two … paintings …
— William Grimes
… the play was a commission of the Guthrie Theatre in Minneapolis …
— Sharon Eberson

definition: authority to act for, in behalf of, or in place of another
examples: … had summoned all the clans which acknowledged his commission …
— T. B. Macaulay

definition: a task or matter entrusted to one as an agent for another
examples: executed a commission for me while he was in Singapore

definition: a group of persons directed to perform some duty
examples: The state set up a commission to study the proposed merger of the school districts.

definition: a government agency having administrative, legislative, or judicial powers
examples: regulatory powers exercised by the Federal Trade Commission

definition: a city council having legislative and executive functions
examples: She served on the city's water commission.

definition: an act of committing something
examples: commission of a crime

definition: a fee paid to an agent or employee for transacting a piece of business or performing a service, a percentage of the money received from a total paid to the agent responsible for the business
examples: He gets a commission for each car he sells.

definition: an act of entrusting or giving authority
examples: the commission of limited powers to the administrator

definition: under the authority of commissioners
ready for active service
in use or in condition for use
examples: The Internet connection is back in commission.

definition: with commission serving as partial or full pay for work done
examples: an artist working on commission

definition: out of active service or use
examples: The ferry was put out of commission because of the bad weather.

definition: out of working order
examples: The elevator was out of commission.

definition: to furnish with a commission: such as
to confer a formal commission on
examples: was commissioned lieutenant

definition: to appoint or assign to a task or function
examples: was commissioned to do the biography

definition: to order to be made
examples: commissioned a portrait

definition: to put (a ship) in commission
examples: The ship was commissioned in 2004.
